titlePart.text: APPLIANCES FOR COMMUNICATING WITH THE BLIND OR DEAF

titlePart.entryReference: devices for psychotechnics or for testing reaction times

noteParagraph.text: A simulator is regarded as a teaching or training device proper to this sub-class if the simulator gives perceptible sensations having a likeness to the sensations the student would experience in reality in response to actions taken by him. Simulators which demonstrate by means involving computing, the functioning of apparatus or of a system are classified in class if no provision exists elsewhere. Simulator components which are identical with real devices or machines or components thereof are classified in the relevant sub-classes for these devices or machines and not in sub-class .
Models of buildings, installations, or the like are covered by this sub-class.

titlePart.text: Manually or mechanically operated educational appliances using elements forming or bearing symbols, signs, pictures, or the like which are arranged or adapted to be arranged in one or more particular ways
and having a support carrying or adapted to carry the elements
the elements each bearing a single symbol or a single combination of symbols
and being attachable to, or mounted on, the support
by means of pins and holes
by means of ring-like securing elements
titlePart.entryReference: sheets temporarily attached together by rings or coils ,

titlePart.text: the elements being slidably mounted on the support
the elements each bearing a plurality of different symbols, signs, or combinations of symbols and signs, only one symbol, sign, or combination thereof, of each element to be used at a time
and bearing the symbols on a surface parallel to the axis of rotation
and bearing the symbols on a surface perpendicular to the axis of rotation
the elements being in flexible-strip form, e.g. endless bands
the elements being arranged in fan form
wherein the elements are adapted to be arranged in co-operation with the support to form symbols
comprising elements to be used without a special support
the elements to be placed loosely in adjacent relationship
the elements being connectible by corresponding projections and recesses
to form symbols or signs by appropriate arrangement
Manually- or mechanically-operated teaching appliances working with questions and answers
of the type wherein the student is expected to construct an answer to the question which is presented or wherein the machine gives an answer to the question presented by the student
of the multiple-choice answer type, i.e. where a given question is provided with a series of answers and a choice has to be made

titlePart.entryReference: having one set of answers common to a plurality of questions

titlePart.text: wherein one set of answers is common to a plurality of questions
with visual presentation of the material to be studied, e.g. using film strip
with audible presentation of the material to be studied
titlePart.entryReference: reading and recognising printed or written characters

titlePart.text: with both visual and audible presentation of the material to be studied
providing for individual presentation of information to a plurality of student stations
all student stations being capable of presenting the same information simultaneously
different stations being capable of presenting different information simultaneously
with provision for individual teacher-student communication
Electrically-operated teaching apparatus or devices working with questions and answers
of the type wherein the student is expected to construct an answer to the question which is presented or wherein the machine gives an answer to the question presented by the student
characterised by modifying the teaching programme in response to a wrong answer, e.g. repeating the question, supplying a further explanation
of the multiple-choice answer type, i.e. where a given question is provided with a series of answers and a choice has to be made from the answers
providing for individual presentation of questions to a plurality of student stations
all student stations being capable of presenting the same questions simultaneously
different stations being capable of presenting different questions simultaneously
characterised by modifying the teaching programme in response to a wrong answer, e.g. repeating the question, supplying further information
wherein a set of answers is common to a plurality of questions
characterised by modifying the teaching programme in response to a wrong answer, e.g. repeating the question, supplying further information
Simulators for teaching or training purposes
for teaching control of vehicles or other craft
for teaching control of land vehicles
for teaching control of ships, boats, or other waterborne vehicles
for teaching control of aircraft, e.g. Link trainer
Teaching hand-writing, shorthand, drawing, or painting
Finger, hand, or arm supporting devices
Devices involving the use of transparent or translucent tracing material, e.g. copy books
Devices used in association with a real typewriter, teleprinter, or the like
Boards or like means for providing an indication of notes
Devices for exercising or strengthening fingers or arms
Devices for holding fingers or arms in a proper position for playing
titlePart.entryReference: exercising apparatus for developing or strengthening the muscles for physical training ,

titlePart.text: Line indicators or other guides or masks
for increasing the rate of reading
Teaching not covered by other main groups of this sub-class
titlePart.entryReference: teaching or practice apparatus for gun-aiming or gun-laying
with audible presentation of the material to be studied
with audible presentation of the material to be studied

titlePart.text: Printed or written appliances, e.g. textbooks, bilingual letter assemblies, charts
Control of vehicles or other craft
Teaching, or communicating with, blind persons, deaf persons, deaf and dumb persons
titlePart.entryReference: audible presentation of material to be studied
audible indication of meter readings or of colour
methods or arrangements for reading and recognising printed or written characters
methods or arrangements for picking-up and recognising spoken words

titlePart.text: Devices for conversing with the deaf-blind
Models for scientific, medical, or mathematical purposes, e.g. full-sized device for demonstration purposes
for geometry, trigonometry, projection, or perspective
Models for purposes not provided for in group , e.g. full-sized devices for demonstration purposes
titlePart.entryReference: model vehicles, tracks therefor, models in the nature of toys

titlePart.text: of scenic effects, e.g. trees, rocks, water surfaces

titlePart.entryReference: devices for holding or supporting maps

titlePart.text: the sections being arranged in the form of a foldable sheet or sheets
of belt form, e.g. endless belt
Map spot or co-ordinate position indicators
